snippet: After storming the Pakistan Television building and cutting transmission cables in the newsrooms, antigovernment demonstrators yielded to the military.
abstract: Pakistan's political crisis deepens when hundreds of protesters storm headquarters of state-run television network in Islamabad, causing temporary lapse in transmission until army troops regain control and secure the building.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Declan Walsh from London.

lead_paragraph: After storming the Pakistan Television building and cutting transmission cables in the newsrooms, antigovernment demonstrators yielded to the military.

headline.main: Pakistani Protesters Ransack State Television Headquarters
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Protesters Ransack State Television Headquarters
